title: Supreme Court Rules for Northwestern Employees in Retirement-Plan Case
sub_head: Court also rejects Kevin McCarthy’s suit against proxy voting rules in the House
body:
WASHINGTON—The Supreme Court said Monday that employers must regularly review their retirement offerings, unanimously ruling for Northwestern University employees who argued its defined-contribution plan offered a confusing number of expensive investment options.
Separately, the court added several significant cases to its fall docket, including a suit that could limit federal power to combat water pollution by narrowing the definition of wetlands covered by the Clean Water Act.
